stories.title: Show HN: I have built a Chrome extension for collaborative web browsing
The History of Money in America [video][35:40]

stories.text:
I have a friend who has been offered a position at a tech startup. He will be a software engineer. There are already more than 5 employees (including CEO, etc.), but less than 10.

Besides a salary, he has been offered around .2% of the total shares, vesting over 4 years.

Is that about the right amount? My gut feeling is that it is too low.

I'm wondering what "similarly early" employees have been offered at other startups. Examples would be welcome.
stories.title: Ask HN: How much equity should an early employee get?

stories.text:
I'm a student, and am reading a lot of older papers about distributed systems for an OS class.  It seems like the word "transparent" is used to refer to a system which hides information to the user, like a black box.[0]  Why is this the case? can anyone actually explain why this does in fact make sense or is it just horrible naming?
[0] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transparency_(human%E2%80%93computer_interaction)
stories.title: Ask HN: Why does transparency mean the opposite of what it should?
